loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y tiene un carisma muy contagiante. Gregorio desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y por ello tuvo la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven. 

Cada día Gregorio se levanta muy temprano para ir a su trabajo, el labora como obrero agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo trabajador.

Gregorio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como arena, fierro, ladrillos, entre otros; ya que podrá realizar el cercado de su vivienda,  así tendrá mas seguridad y su familia mejorara su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 41 years old and lives in the city of Pisco. He has a contagious charisma. From an early age he learned how to support himself with his own hard work, since his parents had few economic resources.

Each day Gregorio rises very early to go to work. He works as an agricultural worker for an agricultural holding in his city. With what he earns from his work, he is able to pay his household expenses. He believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible, and above all, hardworking.

Gregorio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support they give him, he will be able to buy construction materials such as sand, iron and bricks, among others. With these he will be able to finish the peripheral wall that surrounds his home, and therefore provide more security and a better quality of life to his family. This will also allow him to continue striving for his greatest dream, which is to finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, iron and bricks, among others.

loans.name: Elqui Ismael

texts.es:
Elqui es un joven de 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, limón, entre otros productos.  Elqui tiene un carisma contagiante y sobre todo lucha cada día para poder salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres.

Día a día Elqui trabaja como agricultor, en su pequeña parcela, actualmente ha sembrado, arroz y maíz; Elqui cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

Elqui está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar semillas, abono y comprar fertilizantes asi podra sembrar un nuevo producto y mantener en buen estado su cultivo, con lo cual podrá tener una mejor cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos; así su familia mejorar su calidad de vida y Elqui seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Elqui is a young man of 23 and lives in the city of Guadalupe, which is noted for having a warm and inviting climate. As well, agriculture is carried on there, especially the cultivation of rice, lemons, and other crops.

Elqui has a contagious charm and above all, he strives each day to succeed and help his parents. Every day, Elqui works as a farmer on his small parcel of land. Currently he has planted rice and corn. 

Elqui believes he is getting ahead in life because he is responsible, and especially because he has a great desire to succeed for the sake of his family. 

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided, as thanks to it he will be able to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers. This way he will be able to plant a new crop and maintain it in good condition. He will be able to have a better harvest, improve his income, and thereby his family's quality of life. 

Elqui will continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: "to study for university degree."

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband provides construction services, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently her husband wants to purchase sheltering material such as metal sheets and pillars for his work. However, due to a lack of financing, he is having difficulty purchasing the things he needs. 

Therefore his wife Nazeeran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the necessary items for her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful to her husband. 

The shortage of water in summer season creates a lot of problems in her community, and, therefore, Nazeeran wants to use her profits to improve the water supply system in the area. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase sheltering material such as metal sheets and pillars for her husband's work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jaicee

texts.en:
Jaicee is a 25-year-old woman who is married with two children ages 4 years old and 1 year old. She and her family live in Ubay, Bohol. Jaicee's husband works for a courier company. On the other hand, Jaicee sells electronic load from companies like Globe, Smart and Sun.  This business is almost two years old now and helps her to buy her children's needs like diapers and milk.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more electronic load and wood to renovate her house.

In the future, she hopes to have other businesses to rely on so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more electronic load to resell and wood for house renovation

loans.name: Ma. Susana

texts.en:
Ma. Susana is 44 years old and lives in CPG, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 17. Ma. Susana runs a motorcycle taxi business (called habal-habal) and has had this business for five years now. This business earns her 1,500 PHP per month. 

Ma. Susana is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy gasoline, sprockets, and spare tire. This will help her operate her business without delays. In the future, she hopes to give her children a proper education and a better chance in life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, sprockets, and spare tire

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has worked many years in the commercial trucking industries and made a decent living for himself and his family but always felt the urge to take charge of his own business.

Alejandro is the sole provider of his household and began looking for ways to cut expenses.  He spent hundreds of dollars monthly leasing a commercial truck but needed a way to begin buying a truck outright for his Dallas business,  AS Trucks.  After visiting local banking institutions and receiving denials, Alejandro turned to Accion Texas Inc.  

The loan from Accion allowed Alejandro to begin investing in ownership of a commercial truck and eventually becoming the sole owner.  He now pays less per month to use his vehicle daily and contributes more financially to his family.  Alejandro continues to work and haul for commercial businesses and looks forward to owning his own commercial truck and adding more routes to take on for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Vitas Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! Vida, age 38, is from Mutare. She is married and has two children, both of them attending school. Vida also cares for two dependents. Vida runs an agro-business, raising chickens. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that her clients are failing to pay on time, after they buy on credit.

Vida has requested a loan of $1,200. She will use it to buy more chicks and laying hens. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future, Vida plans to supply eggs and chickens to bigger supermarkets, like Spar, OK and TM.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed, day-old chicks and laying hens

loans.name: Beverly Johelin

texts.es:
Beverly,es una joven de 22 años de edad, casada, vive en la ciudad de Managua, de oficio comerciante, vende cosméticos y joyas de plata este negocio lo inicio a los 19 años , necesitaba ingresos para no depender solo de su esposo por eso decidió empezar a vender mercadería de manera ambulante esto le ha permitido a ella ayudar con los gastos del hogar y lograr independencia económica. Ella junto con su suegra salen a vender su mercadería a empresas y cliente de su vecindario ofreciendo perfumes para damas, caballeros, anillos, cadenas , pulseras etc. 
Hoy esta necesitando el financiamiento para comprar ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, anillos ,pulseras . Su idea es agregar productos que antes no vendía para ofrecer variedad a su clientela su idea es llegar a tener una tienda de ropa con variedades en cosméticos y perfumes.
texts.en:
Beverly is a 22-year-old young woman.  She is married and lives in the city of Managua.  She is a businesswoman and sells makeup and silver jewelry.  She started this business when she was 19 year old because she needed her own income so as to not have to depend solely on her husband.  For this reason, she decided to start selling merchandise as a street vendor, which has allowed her to help with the household expenses and achieve economic independence.  She sells her merchandise together with her mother-in-law at other businesses and customers in her community.

She offers women's perfumes, rings, and bracelets.  Her idea is to add products that she hasn't sold before so she can offer a variety to her customers.  She hopes to have a clothing store with a variety of cosmetics and perfume.

loans.use: buy underwear, makeup, perfume, rings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en:
Taunese is 39 years old and married with seven children. She makes and sells printed elei design materials to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Taunese has requested a loan to buy materials, including colored paints and elei board, and to pay for her kids' school fees. She plans to use her profits to help her family and for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, including colored paints and elei board, and to pay her kids' school fees

loans.name: Jimpson

texts.es:
Jimpson, es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad  de Pucallpa, la cual se encuentra en la selva peruana y tiene una fauna y flora maravillosa.  Jimpson es un joven con un carisma contagiante y sobre todo con muchas ganas der salir adelante, por ello con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera técnica de instalación de conexiones eléctricas. Gracias a ello ha logrado conseguir empleo en un pequeño taller en la cual puede atender a sus clientes y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. 

Jimpson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar unos materiales que le están faltando y le son muy útiles para desempeñar su trabajo como alicates, tarugos, medidores de voltaje, entre otros;  de esta manera podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para poder atender a sus clientes y así seguir mejorando sus ingresos y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener su propio taller y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Jimpson is a 25-year-old young man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is located in the Peruvian rainforest and has marvellous flora and fauna. Jimpson is a young man with an infectious charm and, above all, a great desire to get ahead. Because of that, with a great deal of effort, he managed to complete a technical program in installation of electrical systems. Thanks to that program, he has been able to get employment in a small workshop where he can help his customers. With the fruits of his labor, he helps his parents with household costs. 

Jimpson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to purchase some materials he lacks that are useful for carrying out his work, like pliers, wall anchors, voltage meters, and others. Then he will have the necessary tools to help his customers, continue improving his income, and to make his greatest dream a reality: to have his own workshop and to be able to pursue a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase tools like pliers, wall anchors, voltage meters, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a tricycle driver.

Gina is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business and augment her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment in the same business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Calamarca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALAMARCA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, tejido de suéter para bebe, puesto de dulces y comida, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas y tejido, portera de colegio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al ver la necesidad de sus productos en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones, el área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Calamarca" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of six members, and is led by a board of directors of which Rosa is the chair. 

The businesses carried on by the members of the communal bank are varied, and include a bookstore, knitting baby sweaters, candy and food stand, neighborhood store, weaving of shawls and textiles, and school caretaker. 

The loan they will take out is to benefit small business people such as Rosa. She says that is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of a field representative of the institution, who came to visit her at home. 

Currently she has a bookstore business, and says that she launched it through her own initiative, on seeing the need for her products in her area. The loan she will now take out is to increase her capital (purchase of school supplies), which she will acquire at wholesale in the markets of the city of La Paz, and later sell at her shop.

This form of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her household as best she can, as she lives with her partner and has a child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit, the training, the health clinic and the savings program.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She lives with her family in the town of Albur, Bohol. She has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Saturnina is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales and profit. In the future, Saturnina hopes to make her business successful and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children and belongs to a very poor family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Currently, he needs to purchase new parts for his rickshaw. However, due to a lack of funds he is finding this difficult.

Therefore Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing rickshaw parts. This will help him to continue his business and to generate income to sustain his family. Razia is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase rickshaw parts.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth is a food vendor from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Julieth is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, sweet potato, banana, and cooking oil. With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods, thus improving her sales and profits. In the future, Julieth hopes to make her business a success and to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like glutinous rice, sugar, sweet potato, banana, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 47 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school.  She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn has been pig fattening for five years now

Roselyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 49 years old and married with twelve children. With three children currently in school, Ludivina works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ludivina has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as those listed above. 

Ludivina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Avelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Avelina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Avelina has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Avelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more quantities of garlic, different spices and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie is 47 years old and is married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Genelie is borrowing 17000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a variety of rice and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Genelie has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the realization of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of rice and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old and married. She started the business of a sari-sari store in the market 20 years ago. When her four children finished their college, she decided to put up her store in front of their house. Now Angelina is selling a few grocery items and, at the same time, cooking menus for meals.  

Angelina wishes to earn a higher income and save some of it for the future emergencies of her husband. She is acquiring a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy meat and ingredients for cooking menus, and soft drinks to sell. 

She is hoping that by borrowing this loan, she will earn a higher income to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy meat and ingredients for cooking menus, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Marissa

texts.en:
Maria Marissa is 48 years old. She is married with three children, ages 12-20. Ma. Marissa is into weaving mats for an income. Woven mats are usually used for sleeping purposes because of the comfort that they offer during the summer season, when it is very humid. 

Ma. Marissa is asking for a loan to buy dye and buri (palm leaves) for her business. Availability of these inputs will help her be more productive in her weaving and earn a better income. 

In the future, she hopes to have other businesses so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy dye and buri.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 51 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su pareja y sus dos hijos.Margarita tiene un gimnasio, y son sus hijos quienes lo administran pero tambien tiene una mototaxi que le da a una persona para que lo trabaje y de esa manera reciba un ingreso extra para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Antes de tener la actividad que realiza, Margarita tenía problemas económicos por que no contaba con un trabajo fijo y una casa propia por lo que los gastos superaban sus ingresos por eso paso muchas necesidades, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable con el cual apoyar a su familia.Para Margarita este es el primer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido el cual le sera muy util para mejorar su pequeña empresa.
Margarita, invertirá los S/. 3500 soles en la compra de máquinas para hacer ejercicios.
texts.en:
Margarita is 51 years old, and a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives in a rented house with her partner and their two children. Margarita owns a gym that her children run. But she also has a mototaxi, which she rents out to a person to operate. This way she receives extra income to improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

Before having the work she does, Margarita had financial problems because she didn't have a steady job nor her own home, so expenses exceeded her income. That is why she experienced many privations. But thanks to her effort she was able to move forward in life, and now has a stable business with which to support her family. 

This is Margarita's first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial assistance received, which will be a great help to her in improving her small business. Margarita will use the 3500 soles to purchase exercise machines.

loans.use: To buy exercise machines.

loans.name: Tumur-Ochir

texts.en:
Tumur-Ochir is 53 years old and lives with his wife, two daughters, son-in-law, and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their old house on ring-fenced land. 

Tumur-Ochir has been working as an electrician since 1999 at a private business where his wife is employed as a cook. His elder daughter currently stays at home looking after her 4-year-old son. His son-in-law previously worked in China on an employment contract, and came back to Mongolia in January. 

The house this extended family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. Tumur-Ochir is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase putty, paint, concrete blocks, bricks, cement, and sand. Using these materials, he can repair the old house so that it looks good and is energy efficient. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and emit less smoke, which will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, bricks, cement, and sand

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school. 

Rhodora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rhodora has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rhodora has been raising pigs for six years now. She has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla de maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos y ello adquirió una vaca lechera; se mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y se encuentran muy bien de salud, las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Alexander is applying for a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his growing of basic staples. This will allow him to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and corn seed. The previous loan helped him to increase his income, and with this he bought a dairy cow.

His family group remains the same and are in very good health. Their financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: To buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and corn seed.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 54-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Her husband wants to purchase new tires for the rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing tires for the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is 28 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and gas for the oven to start her business. In the future, Sau hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and gas for the oven

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gina has a business selling seashells in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more seashells to sell.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seashells to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 32 years old and married with four children.

Mercedita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, noodles, snack foods, etc. in her general store.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Mercedita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, noodles, snack foods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a food vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two grown-up children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Letecia sells home-cooked snack foods and drinks to the people in her place. As of now, she dreams of expanding her business but lacks the capital to do so. With this, she joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to microentrepreneurs like her.

Letecia is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, milk, baking powder, cooking oil and others. With a loan, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus, augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Letecia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, milk, baking powder, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 61 years old, married, and has ten children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tomasa has been farming vegetables for 9 years, and earns additional income from hog-raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Vidal no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito para estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Pollo Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Vidal trabaja en el rubro de construcción como maestro de obras, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados que le da a sus obras y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Vidal se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abarrotes y bebidas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para  iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, de esta manera Vidal espera poder tener mayores ingresos económicos y así desea lograr su gran sueño de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vida is a 55 year old man. He lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and children who he loves. They are his main reason for living. Vidal is a friendly, enthusiastic, and hardworking person. Together with his wife, they've dedicated all of their efforts to getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and because Vidal has had to work since he was very young to help his parents, he could not finish primary school which has made it impossible for him to study a professional career. 

Of his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Vidal works in the field of construction as a foreman. He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes it's going well because of the good finishes he puts in his work and because of the kind treatment he offers others. In his free time, Vidal likes to cook a delicious fried chicken to share with his family. 

Vidal is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he will be able to purchase groceries and beverages which will help him start a small business selling staple products. In this way, Vidal hope to be able to have larger economic income so that he will be able to achieve his big dream of offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in Loon, Bohol. She has engaged in a tricycle transport business together with her husband for more than 13 years now. This is their main source of income. 

Teresita is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this loan,Teresita hopes to maintain the good working condition of their vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Amapolas I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAPOLAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betzabe es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, venta de dulces, heladería, venta de tostados, tienda de barrio, venta de lentejas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de ropa americana, tienda de abarrotes, tienda de plásticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betzabe es integrante, ella indica que es el décimo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años con el primer préstamo que saco de la institución Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “AMAPOLAS” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the "Centro Focal de Los Andes". The group is comprised of twelve members and is governed by a Board of Directors led by Betzabe, their President. The businesses run by the members of this communal association are varied. They include: selling fried potatoes with hotdogs, selling candy, an icecream shop, selling roasted corn kernels, a neighbourhood store, selling lentils, selling vegetables, selling food, selling American-style clothing, a grocery store, and a store that sells plastic items. 

The loan they take out will benefit these small-business owners including Betzabe. She states that this is their tenth time joining Pro Mujer (For Women). They became members after being invited to do so by a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling vegetables. She notes that she started this business ten years ago with the first loan that she took from Pro Mujer (For Women). 

The loan will be used to increase resources; to purchase vegetables from markets in the city of La Paz. These items will later be sold from her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can. She is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer (For Women) her response is that she likes the savings, the workshops, the loans and the health-care aspect.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 48 years old, widowed with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, chicken and frozen foods for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for three years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like  vegetables, meat, chicken and frozen foods for her business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 40 years old. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter who's name is Nazira and Akram who is 10 years old. 

Her husband is a migrant in Russia and that’s why it is very difficult for Aziza to provide her children with all necessary things. 

Aziza is a smart teacher.  Until 2005 year she worked at the kindergarten which is located in the center of her region.  Since then she has been busy raising her children.  

Now, Aziza is going to start her own business.  She wants to open private kindergarten at her house.  She lives with her family in the house which is in poor condition.  Her house is old and it needs some repairs.  In winter it has too much heat loss through windows and doors due to damage to them. 

So, Aziza must repair all rooms to open her kindergarten.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy building materials such as wood, cement and etc.  Aziza awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials as wood, cement and make repairs to her home in order to open her private kindergarten.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 2°  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, con ingresos medios. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ella hace en la venta de comestibles, esta saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora, que empieza sus días de trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, y por medio de ese arduo trabajo está saliendo adelante y está creciendo. Lidia solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comestibles, y de esa forma poder aumentar sus ingresos y superar la línea de pobreza.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mistica group is in their second cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead.  They are doing a survey of poverty elimination which will allow them to understand the situation of each one of them.  

One of the members is Lidia, who on her last survey showed a poverty level of two, which means with average income.  Due to her effort and the work she continues selling food, she is succeeding and helping her family.  Lidia is a hardworking person who starts her work days very early.  Due to that hard work, she is getting ahead and growing.  

Lidia is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to continue making her food so that she can increase her income and overcome the poverty line.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, greens, and others.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 29 años de edad se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 3 años, cuando le recomendaron emprender este tipo de negocio y se dio cuenta de la buena rentabilidad que tenia. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y tiene un local en el que vende de contado, el cual se encuentra ubicado donde reside impactando las  ventas entre sus vecinos y referidos por estos, quienes son su principal mercado. En la actualidad su meta es ampliarlo y mas adelante hacer apertura de un nuevo punto comercial, con el fin de genera mayores ingresos y poder brindarle un mayor bienestar y una educación de calidad a sus hijas.  Gloria requiere tener un mayor inventario de calzado en las líneas de damas, caballeros e infantil y esto es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará estas líneas y satisfacer la demanda potencial y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Gloria, 29, began selling shoes three years ago on a recommendation and after determining that the business would be profitable. Her business has slowly grown, and she has a space in her house where she sells merchandise for cash, mostly to neighbors and referrals. Her goal is to expand now and to open in another commercial space later on so that she can earn more and offer her daughters better living conditions and a good education.

Gloria needs more inventory of men's, women's, and children's footwear, so she has applied to Kiva for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy new shoes to meet potential customer demand and turn her Kiva loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's footwear.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La Señora Zoraida es una trabajadora de la alcaldía municipal es responsable de la biblioteca, es luchadora.
Soltera madre de cuatro hijos  ya todos casados. 

El dinero lo solicita para mejora de vivienda para la compra de materiales como zinc y cemento. Se siente muy bien trabajar con ceprodel ya que estos créditos le han ayudado a poder terminar de hacer su casa.

"Gracias ceprodel, gracias kiva, con poco salario que ganó eh llegado a hacer realidad mis sueños"
texts.en:
Zoraida is an employee of the municipal government and is responsible for the library.  She is a fighter.  She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are married.

She is requesting this loan to improve her home by purchasing materials such as zinc sheeting and cement.  She feels very good about working with Ceprodel since the loans have helped her be able to finish her home.

She says, "Thank you Ceprodel, thank you Kiva.  With the small salary I earned, I have made my dreams a reality."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc sheeting and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cement and sand for a construction supplies business

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like paint, wood, bamboo and other items for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Sucett has been in this business for five years. Sucett earns additional income from food vending.

Sucett has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like paint, wood, bamboo and other items for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Gina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, slippers and certain home appliances.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, slippers and home appliances.

loans.name: Gea

texts.en:
This is Gea, 42, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, a maintenance crew member and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Gea operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Gea hopes that her business will grow larger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en:
Batkhishig, 40 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia.  From 1999 to 2010, he has been working at a train station and due to a disability he gave up his job and began taking a state pension. 

In 2013, after two years of unemployment, he began working as a driver on contract with private a business entity.  His wife currently sells food stuffs at a grocery store by renting a stall. 

He is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase an electric car.  Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the on board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. 

As Ulaanbaatar is considered to have the greatest air pollution in Mongolia, purchasing of electric car should be encouraged. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Ryan Michael

texts.en:
Ryan Michael is 25 years old from Anda, Bohol.  He is single and a hard worker.  He drives a motorized carriage to earn an income to help his parents. 

But since he also dreams of a better life, he is planning to start a hog raising business.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 PHP to buy feed and piglet to start a piggery. 
 
In the future, Ryan Michael hopes to be a successful businessman with multiple successful business, for his future family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglet to start a piggery.

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura; es un trabajo que aprendió de su padre, ya que era la única forma de obtener ingresos para la alimentación de su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y zapatos para trabajar porque las botas de hule le afectan por el calor. Con el crédito comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez, ya que muchas veces se ha quedado sin aplicarlos por falta de dinero. En otras ocasiones se ha quedado sin el dinero para la alimentación por comprar los insumos agrícolas. Su deseo es casarse y construir su casa para formar su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old and single.  He has always worked as a farmer.  It is work he learned from his father since it is the only way of earning income to feed his family.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase four sacks of manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and work shoes since his rubber boots are affected by the heat.  He will purchase all the supplies once since many times he has had to not apply them due to a lack of money.  On other occasions, he has been without money for food in order to buy farming supplies.

His dream is to get married and build a house so he can start a family.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and work shoes.

loans.name: Vendedora

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is being offered to Vendedora to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional inventory such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, seasoning and other items. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2000. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, seasoning and other items to sell

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo más en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar artículos  básicos tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, carnes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las ventas, incrementar los inventarios y obtener mayores ganancias; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Ana has applied for a loan to continue investing in her business. The loan will allow her to buy basic items such as beans, rice, sugar, meats, and more. The previous loan helped her to increase sales, inventory, and profits, which improved her financial situation and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, meats, and more.

loans.name: Robert Nicolas

texts.es:
Robert es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y es un joven muy carismático y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Dia a día Robert trabaja como ayudante de construcción y como pintor de casas culminadas, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa con esfuerzo sus gastos estudiantiles ya que él se encuentra cursando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma, Robert trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y por las tardes acude a su centro de estudios, Robert cree que esta saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo es muy responsable.

Robert está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su hogar, ya que actualmente cocina a leña y debido a ello ha tenido algunos accidentes; de esta manera Robert podrá colaborar con el bienestar de su familia y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Robert is a 26 year old young man who lives in the city of Imperial. He is very charismatic and above all he wishes to get ahead. Robert works as a helper in construction and a house painter day-to-day. With the fruit of his work going to his student expenses, he finds him self pursuing a degree in Agricultural Engineering. Robert works around 9 hours a day and goes to the schools in the evenings. He believes he is getting ahead because he tries hard and above all, he is very responsible. 

Robert is very grateful to Kiva's loaners. Thanks to the help they've offered, he is able to buy a gas stove for his home. Currently, he is cooking with wood, and because of this, there have been some accidents. In this manner, Robert will be able to contribute to the well-being of his family and keep fighting each day to be able to make his biggest dream a reality: to finish his education in Agricultural Engineering and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 33 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife.  Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but his loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

His only source of the income is small.  He works as an operator at a private company.  He struggles to provide food for the family.  According to Credo estimations, the family is in the subsistence poor category. 

Vazha requested loan from Credo to install gas equipment in his car so he can serve local people as a taxi driver.  This will increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Vazha's family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car so he can serve local people as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Delinda

texts.es: Delinda, de  55 años de edad es una mujer alegre y muy emprendedora , es madre de soltera de dos hijos de 24 y 21 años de edad respectivamente quienes estan estudiando en la universidad . Delinda se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como golosinas, bebidas gasificadas,arroz, azúcar, plátano y otros productos más. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local que esta en su propia vivienda. Lleva 13 años en este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien ya que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para estar a lado de su familia además que tiene muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes, que son sus vecinos y personas que transitan por su calle.Este será  su préstamo numero 06 con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado el cual le permite sacar adelante a su negocio.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles comprará arroz, plátano, carbón, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas, entre otros ya que al comprar al por mayor reduce costos y se genera más ganancias.
texts.en:
Delinda, 55, is very happy and enterprising. She is the single mother of two children, ages 24 and 21, who attend college. Delinda sells food items such as sweets, sodas, rice, sugar, plantains, and more from a space in her house. She has successfully run the business for 13 years with help from her children. She is most happy that her work allows her time to be with her family. She also earns a good income because she has always had customers among her neighbors and passersby. 

This is her sixth loan cycle with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the funding that has let her grow her business. She will use the loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, plantains, charcoal, sweets, sodas, and more at wholesale to reduce costs and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, plantains, sweets, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a 38-year-old married woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in poultry and hog raising business for more than five years now with her husband. Tessie is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and to purchase feed. With these new piglets and money for feed she will be able to improve her business as well as her increase her income. In the future, Tessie hopes to make her business sustainable and productive .

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to purchase feed

loans.name: Solidario Flor De Pascua Group

texts.es: Solidario Flor de Pascua, este crupo esta conformado por la señora Norma Elizabeth de 46 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en variedad ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años ya que es la unica forma que tiene para salir adelante, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Norma Elizabeth, 46, is a member of the communal bank Flor de Pascua. She has been selling a variety of new clothing for six years. This business is her only source of income. She has applied for a loan to buy new clothing to sell, and she hopes the loan will be funded.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Stefany

texts.es:
Patricia es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia: gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Patricia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Patricia trabaja como Asistente de Contabilidad en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 9 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Patricia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de un curso taller de especialización que requiere para su carrera profesional, de esta manera Patricia tendrá mejores conocimientos y será más competente para conseguir un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 19-year-old young woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and her little son, whom she loves and who is her principal reason for living. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person; together with her husband, she dedicates all her effort to providing for her family. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Patricia is now studying toward a degree in accounting. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and, on occasion, cook a delicious "arroz chaufa" [Peruvian fried rice] to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Patricia works as an Accounting Assistant at a company in her city. She works every day for approximately nine hours, and she believes that it's going well for her because of her good performance and her courteous treatment of others.

Patricia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help provided, she will be able to cover the costs of a specialty workshop course required by her degree program. This way, Patricia will have better knowledge and be more competent, so that she can get a better job.

loans.use: to cover the costs of a workshop course.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William tiene  28 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad   vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

William se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, además se dedica a la venta de abrigos de lana para damas y caballeros.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar abrigos de hombre y mujer. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que le hace mucha falta.
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Quito y las ventas las realiza dentro y fuera de la provincia Bolívar.
El sueño es mejorar los pedidos y vender en el extranjero. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y la pobreza en la vida cotidiana.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el boli.
texts.en:
William is 28 years old and he is single.  He has one 7-year-old child with whom he lives in the city of Guaranda in the Bolívar province.  He is a member of the Los Pinos communal bank.  It is made up of 14 members who are from the same community where they work in agriculture and are 40 minutes from the Pangua Community Office.

William makes a living in agriculture planting corn and wheat.  He also makes a living selling wool coats for ladies and gentlemen.  He is requesting a loan to buy coats for men and women.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the merchandise that he really needs.  He will make the purchases in the city of Quito and carry out sales inside and outside of the Bolívar province.  

His dream is to get better orders and to sell abroad.  The challenges that he faces are competition and the poverty of everyday life.

In his free time he likes to play sports, volleyball in particular.

loans.use: to buy coats for men and women.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar. El tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 9 y 13 años; el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le ayudara mejorar la productividad y aumentar las utilidades.
Su sueño es fortalecer el trabajo para tener mayores ingresos, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y financiar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adolfo grows basic grain crops to earn income and pay his household expenses. He is 42, married, and has two children, ages 9 and 13. He learned his trade from his parents, and he works Monday to Saturday from 6:00 AM until noon.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, weed killer, pesticide, and more to increase his productivity and profit. His dream is to strengthen his business so that he can earn more, offer his family a better life, and pays for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children ages 1 and 3. Her husband is a carpenter and barely earns enough money to buy food for the family. She and her family live in the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is currently engaged in rice farming as well as selling home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar) and pancakes in her neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. 

This loan will sustain Aileen's business and help her meet her children's needs. 
In the future, she hopes to start other business to support some of her family's other needs, for example, the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Isaela

texts.es:
Isaela, de  63 años de edad ,vive en su casa propia junto su esposo ya que sus hijos son mayores e independientes.El trabajo  de Isaela consiste en cultivar plantas cítricas como son limones, mandarinas, naranjas además realiza la crianza de ganado vacuno como actividad secundaria. Realiza está labor en sus terrenos de cultivos los cuales se encuentran a un kilómetro de su vivienda , lleva 20 años en está actividad y eventualmente contrata trabajadores del lugar quienes se dedican al riego, abonado, fertilizado y cuidado de los cultivos además le gusta su actividad laboral porque le permite tener buenas ganancias económicas y le permite estar al lado de su esposo en la dura jornada laboral que ambos tienen . En esta oportunidad solicitará
4000 soles para la comopra de abono orgánico ya que desea tener una buena producción al final de la cosecha .
texts.en:
Isaela, age 63, lives in her own house with her husband because her children are adults and independent.  Isaela’s work consists of cultivating citrus plants like limess, tangerines, and oranges.  She also raises cattle as a secondary business activity.

She does this work on her agricultural land, which is one kilometer from her house.  She has been doing this business activity for 20 years.  She sometimes hires workers from her area to irrigate, clear, fertilize, and care for the crops.  She likes her work activity because it allows her to have good financial income, and it allows her to be by her husband’s side during the hard working day that they both have.

She will now request 4,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer because she wishes to have a good production at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hodonou Group

texts.fr: HODONOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Julienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 32 ans. Julienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Julienne est mariée à un certain Samuel. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Julienne vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des savons depuis vingt ans par la méthode de distribution. Julienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe HODONOU pour consentir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Hodonou is a group of three individiuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Julienne, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Julienne is 32 years old. She did not attend school. Her husband’s name is Samuel. They have two dependent children, both in school. Julienne lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for household needs. In order to do so, Julienne has been selling kitchen utensils and soap via a distribution system for 20 years. Julienne stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business and meeting customer demand, Julienne has joined forces with the other members of the Hodonou group to apply for a new loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos varones. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura; es un trabajo que aprendió de su padre, ya que era la única forma de obtener ingresos para la alimentación de su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de abono, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra. Hay momentos en que se queda sin el dinero para cubrir los gastos del hogar, para comprar los insumos agrícolas y dice que no quiere que se repita y con el crédito eso pretende cultivar y que no falte el alimento en su casa. Su objetivo es ampliar su casa, porque es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 41 and has three sons. He farms, a trade he learned from his father, and this is his sole income source to feed his family. He has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to pay for three sacks of fertilizer, pesticide, and labor. 

At times, he has had no money to pay household expenses and buy farm supplies, a situation he does not wish to repeat. He will use the loan to grow crops and to make sure there is food to feed his family. His goal is to expand his small house.

loans.use: to pay for three sacks of fertilizer, pesticide, and labor.

loans.name: Solidario Las Sunamitas Group

texts.es: Solidario las Sunamitas, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Serapia de 58 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, le da gracias a Dios ya que dia con dia su negocio ba creciendo mas, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima pra la elaboracio y venta de tejidos tipicos ya que sus clientes le piden por mayor y ella no alcanza cubrir las demandas de sus clientes espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Serapia, 58, is a member of the communal bank Las Sunamitas. She has been weaving and selling traditional cloth for 10 years. She thanks God that her business has grown day by day.

She has applied for a loan to buy materials to weave traditional cloth to sell, since her customers buy at wholesale and she cannot meet the demand. She expects that she will be able to do so with this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to weave traditional cloth to sell.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn works hard to support her family.  She is single and runs a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for seven years.

Jennylyn requests a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, can goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.  She successfully repaid her previous loan.

In the future, Jennylyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, can goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Rafaela

texts.es:
Roxana, se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y está soltera; el oficio lo realiza desde hace un año, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y lo lleva a cabo de las 12:00 pm a 6:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar ropa interior femenina, blusas, pantalones, entre  otros prendas de vestir; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y mejorar sus utilidades.
Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos y financiar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Roxana sells clothes in an itinerant manner in order to help her parents with the household expenses.  She is 25 years old and single.  She has been in this line of work for one year.  She learned it on her own initiative, and she does this work from 12:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m.

The loan that she needs will allow her to buy women’s underwear, blouses, and pants, among other garments.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business and improve her profits.

Her dream is to increase her income and to pay for her university studies.

loans.use: to buy women’s underwear, blouses, and pants, among other garments.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, 47 years old, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. They work hard to earn income for their everyday needs.

Juanita is an egg retailer. She buys eggs from wholesalers and then sells them at a little profit. Customers buy their eggs from her due to the low selling prices she offers. She also has a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

Juanita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 that she will use to purchase additional eggs. She will also use the money to buy grocery products for her variety store.

Juanita dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and grocery products.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of five children.  Her husband provides construction services which is the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband wants to purchase sheltering material such as metal sheets for his work.  However due to the lack of finance, he is facing problems to purchase the needful things.  Therefore his wife Shehnaz has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed things for her husband. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for her husband.  The shortage of water supply in summer season creates a lot of problems in her community, therefore, Shehnaz wants to use the profit to add new pipe lines of water to her house.  She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets and other tools for her husband work.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley.  She has three children and has been doing this work for 21 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops and her personal business.

Susan stated what is most enjoyable about farming, "The returns I get from the work I do."  Her biggest challenge is, "Getting the right breed when doing artificial insemination."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kilindi, Mzungu, Bahati.'

Susan was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Juhudi has favorable terms."   Susan was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she said, "They support farmers in doing agribusiness."

Her highest monthly expense is farming.  When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Susan replied "Income from the sale of milk will cater for her family's needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Susan owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water or a sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nassim

texts.en:
Nassim is a 29 year-old, single woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She is a doctor who provides cures and offers good services to her patients. She works nearly all day and is happy to continue this career. 

She would like to improve her small house. She has requested a youth loan of 199,999 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to repair her house. With this she hopes to have a more respectable home and to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 49 year old, married with five children.  They live in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.  She has owned and managed her gardening business for seven years and earns 10,000 monthly. 

However, when Emily became a member of GDMPC she requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Emily wants her garden to double her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 66-year-old widow with five children.

Julita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell of items such as coffee, sugar, milk, soap, shampoo and canned goods.

Julita has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store  for nine years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Julita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell of items such as coffee, sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Benedito

texts.es: Benedito, de 48 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor  y soñador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 Hijos  de 20, 14 y 8 años de edad respecticamente en su casa propia . Benedito se dedica a sembrar cítricos tales como limón, naranja y mandarina. Después de la siembra se dedica a regar y cuidar de los  plantones de las distintas plagas que atacan esta especie. El lugar donde realiza esta actividad se encuentra  a un kilómetro de su vivienda y lleva 14 años en esta actividad económica. Se inició en esta actividad con ayuda de  su suegra y luego compro unas hectáreas de terrenos para realizar sus  propios cultivos pero cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar quienes se dedican a recoger y seleccionar los cítricos que son enviados a los distintos mercados.Al inicio tuvo  dificultades  para  comprar abono orgánico para sus cultivos porque no contaba con le capital necesario para adquirir estos productos pero con el tiempo pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprarlo . Este es su préstamo numero 08 con Kiva y está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado para continuar con su negocio razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles comprará abono organico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Benedito, 48, is an entrepreneur with dreams. He lives with his wife and three children, ages 20, 14, and 8, in his own house. Benedito grows citrus crops like limes, oranges, and mandarins. After planting, he waters and protects the crops from diseases that attack them. His farmland is a kilometer from his home, and he has been doing this work for 14 years. He started farming with his mother-in-law's help and then bought several hectares of land to plant on his own.

At harvest time, he hires local workers to select and pick the citrus fruits that will go to different markets. At first, he had problems buying organic fertilizer for his crops because he lacked the money to do so, but over time he saved enough to buy the supplies.

This is his eight loan cycle with Kiva, and he is grateful for the funding to continue investing in his business. He promises, therefore, to make his payments on time. He will use the loan of 1000 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mapit Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: panadería, costura de chamarras, costura de vestidos de novia, venta de ropa de bebe, promotora de cosméticos, repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su prima que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por herencia de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Mapit Sartasiñani communal bank will start its 18th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is headed by a board of directors.  Pamela is the president.
