texts.es: Anali tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, acompañada de sus dos hijas y un hermano.A muy temprana edad asumió el rol de mama y gracias a su familia pudo salir adelante , su actividad económica se centra en la compra y venta de pollos de chacra, vivos y muertos, hace mas de un año que viene dedicando a este negocio, fue su mama quien le dio la iniciativa de incorporarse a esta actividad al ver que el negocio era rentable, al principio se le dificultaron las cosas por motivos económicos, pero gracias al apoyo de su padre y a su esfuerzo ahora tiene un negocio estable.Con las ganancias de sus ventas espera poner otro negocio dedicado a la venta de productos comestibles siempre buscando mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida sus hijas.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que esta muy agradecida y contenta por el apoyo financiero recibido razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Anali, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de pollos al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en: Anali is 26, single, and lives in her parents' home with her two daughters and a brother. She became a mother at a very young age, and has been able to get ahead thanks to her family. She has bought and sold chickens, live and dead, for a year. Her mother encouraged her to start this business when she saw that it would be profitable. In the beginning things were difficult for economic reasons, but thanks to her father's support and her own hard work she now has a stable business. With her income from her sales, she hopes to open another business selling food products. She is always looking to increase her income and improve her daughters' quality of life. This is her first loan on Kiva, and she is very grateful and happy for the financial support, so she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Anali will invest the 1000 soles in the wholesale purchase of chickens for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, se dedica a la venta de comida variada y de tortillas para obtener ingresos económicos.  Ella vive con una hermana, su hija  y un sobrino; inicio el negocio con ventas de tortillas, ya pasado el tiempo comenzó a hacer comida y logro adquirir utilidades por lo que se decidió establecer el negocio hace cuatro años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar maíz, leña, carnes, bebidas, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, condimentos, entre otros productos; este le permitirá tener los artículos necesarios para el fortalecimiento de su actividad y tener diversidad de comida para ofrecerles a los clientes.
Su sueño es ampliar el local del negocio, incrementar las ventas y los ingresos, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora sells different types of foods and tortillas in order to earn an income.  She lives with her sister, her daughter, and her nephew.  She started her business by selling tortillas and in time also began making food, gain momentum, and decided to set up this business four years ago.

She needs this loan in order to buy corn, firewood, meats, drinks, beans, rice, sugar, condiments, and other things.  This will allow her to have what she needs to strengthen her business and have diversity in the food she offers her customers.

Her dream is to expand her business and increase her sales and income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Salomon 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group named Salomon 2 from the city of Samana's Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Francisca is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a little store where she sells groceries, and she will purchase rice, beans, meat, canned food, flour, sugar, and other goods. She will use the profits to provide for her family. She also plans to save to build a local business next to her house, where she can run her grocery store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, canned food, flour, sugar, and other goods.

loans.name: Las Colmenas Group

texts.en:
Yanna is the group coordinator of Las Colmenas. Her group is located in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic and is composed of 20 micro-entrepreuners. She lives in a simple home structure with her two children and her long-term partner. Yanna said her most difficult challenges have been to complete her university studies and raise and educate her children.

This is Yanna's ninth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza International almost five years ago. She plans to use this loan to purchase different pairs of shoes, for men, women and kids. She has been selling shoes from the beginning and now she is planning to add clothes, underwear and other products. She hopes to increase her inventory with her business profits. She also hopes to save some of the profits because her future plan is to improve her family's living conditions, have enough money to provide a good education for her children, and send the children to university.

She hopes to be able to save enough money to continue improving her family's lives and to make one of her dreams come true, the dream of having a successful business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn earns  a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and toiletries and others. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business.

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell and will help Jackie to generate greater profits and cover basic needs for her family. Jackie hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become a rich woman.

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 53-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small ava plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Ana has requested a loan to buy plastic bags, labels, and petrol, and to pay labor costs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Ana hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, labels, and petrol, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Maria Flor is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. Through this she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Maria Flor hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years. Rosalie earns more income from buying and selling vegetables and fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Sra. Emma tiene 36 años, tiene dos  hijos  de las edades de 10 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de chicharrón de pollo tiene su puesto que se  encuentra en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emma va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como aceite, papa, maíz y pollo para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Emma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo y cena, la Sra. Emma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Emma is 36 and has two children ages 10 and 4. She sells chicken chicharrón [a fried chicken dish] and has a stall in one of the busy streets of Villa Fátima. This loan is her second loan cycle with the institution. Emma will use this loan for the wholesale purchase of supplies such as oil, potato, corn, and chicken for making her dishes. She is requesting this loan because she does not have the cash to make this purchase. Emma experiences challenges in her business - climate and competition from other food businesses. For this reason, she has to try to reduce her costs and improve her dishes' flavour. She will use the profit from this loan to buy utensils and to expand so that she can gain more clientele in the peak hours of lunch and dinner. Emma is a very hard-working person and is happy to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making chicken chicharrón.

loans.name: Gladness Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, namely, Florence and Gladys. They reside in Dansoman.  They decided to form a group, to access credit from ID Ghana, in 2010. They sell foodstuffs, materials and eggs, respectively.

Florence is 42 years old and a foodstuffs seller. She has two children. She gets her goods from the depot in large quantity, and she sells them in the Dansoman community. This is her 10th loan with ID Ghana. She is borrowing the amount of GHS 3,000. She will use it to buy more goods to resell to her customers. 

The entire group needs an amount of GHS 3,700, to buy more goods to resell to their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods to resell to her customers

loans.name: Maa U Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, Vida, Faustina and Eunice. They have been together from 2012 to date. They reside in the Dansoman community. They trade in bowls, second-hand clothes, and footwear, respectively.

Vida is a 28-year-old seller of bowls and second hand  clothing. She is married to John, a 32-year-old mechanic. They have been blessed with two children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well in her business. She has been doing this business for six years. 

Vida is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings, which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. This is her third loan, and she needs GHS 1,000, which she will use to buy more bowls and clothes to sell to her customers.  The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 2,150. They will use the loan to buy more goods, to resell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more bowls and clothes, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en: Felicien is a 36-year-old man from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000  to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. He is also a volunteer at World Vision and has a shop in his village. He plans to reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Wilma is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Wilma has a "buy and sell scrap" business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more scrap to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wilma has been in this business for three years. Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy food-making ingredient called "Maithi" to sell for a profit

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works hard to support her family. Jenalyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, ice boxes, etc., for her fishing business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, ice boxes, etc.  for her fishing business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilou is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients to sell for her food vending business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is 27 years old, a married woman and mother of four children, all school-going.  Naseem has been doing a business of home products sales with the support of her husband. She sells different items like washing machines, juicers, irons, dinner sets and fans to the people of her community. In this way she earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. 

For the expansion of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more products such as fans, irons and dinner sets which ultimately help in growing her sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

 Naseem is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business. She dreams of maximizing her profit from this business and wants to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as fans, irons and dinner sets.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул 45-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее шестеро детей. Она со своей семьей живет в районе Рудаки, который находится в нескольких километрах от столицы. Ее сыновья находятся за рубежом  на заработках. Сафаргул имеет среднее образование. Она швея со стажем  работы 12 лет. Сафаргул очень любит свою профессию и мастерица в своем деле. Сафаргул занимается вышиванием национальной женской одежды и выставляет их на продажу. Она берет кредит для приобретения необходимых тканей для шитья одежды на продажу.
texts.en: Safargul is a 45 year-old woman with six children. She and her family live in Rudaki, which is a few kilometers from the capitol. Her sons are working abroad. Safargul has a high school diploma. She has been sewing for 12 years. She likes her profession a lot and is very skilled. Safargul makes traditional Tadjik women's clothing and puts them up for sale. She is requesting a loan to buy the fabric necessary for making clothing she can sell.

loans.use: to buy the fabric necessary for making clothing she can sell.

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneau Group

texts.fr:
Kercita est la coordonatrice de son groupe Le Modele de Dorneu. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants. Kercita habite dans la région de nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Kercita a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 8 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle a vendu l'artisanat. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du Vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Kercita espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. 

Des autres membres Le Modele De Dorneau ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, la nourritures, cosmetique et chaussures. Kercita dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Kercita is the coordinator of her group Le Modele de Dorneu. She is married and has five children. Kercita lives in the north of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is limited. 

Kercita has been running a business selling various goods for the last eight years. Before that, she sold crafts. 

She would like to use this loan to buy products, [such as] clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc. Kercita hopes that this loan will help her expand her business. 

The other Le Modele De Dorneau members need this loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, food, cosmetics, and shoes. 

Kercita says that her main challenges are those of a large merchant.

loans.use: to buy various goods (cosmetics, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Teresita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Ofat Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three partners, namely Fati, Edna and Dinah, all residing in Dansoman. They have been as a group from 2010 until now and are doing very well. Fati sells charcoal, Edna sells provisions, while Dinah sells food. 

Fati is a 38-year-old charcoal seller who is married to Moro, a 42-year-old businessman. They have six children. This has been her work for the past four years, and she is doing very well. She will use this loan to buy three bags of charcoal and sell to customers. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. 

She has been with ID Ghana for the past three years, and still loves to be part of us. She has taken three loans and has fully repaid all.  On her fourth loan, she is requesting GHS 1,200 to help her meet her customers’ demand. 
 
They need an amount of GHS 2,100 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around the community.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Narcisa dreams of a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
This is Meriam, 29, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is still single and she lives with her parents. She is helping them manage their household and generate income for their family.

Meriam maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Meriam’s dream is for her business to grow bigger and she is hoping that she will be able to help her parents financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 21 years old. She is uneducated, living in a poor area in Haja, Yemen. Her house is very old and in a miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. She has started renovating her house but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a saving account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes for thread making business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 22-year-old second hand clothing seller. She is married to Daniel, a 32-year-old trader. They have two children.

In 2012, she needed to expand her business and through a friend, she was introduced to ID Ghana. She has been doing her business for the past three years. She is a hardworking, industrious, and committed individual ready to go the extra mile. 

This is her second loan and she needs GHS 400 to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothing  to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 12 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business in which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay for some of the school needs for her children. Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and own another clothing business around the center. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman living together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children. 

For the past four years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to being a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more firewood for resale to avoid under-stocking. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for resale to avoid under-stocking.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is a diligent mother and wife who is engaged in buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the market.  She is 42 years old and has only one child. She and her husband aim to become successful and financially stable in order to have a better future.  Her willingness to strengthen her business made her decide to borrow a loan of P5,000 to buy more vegetables such as eggplants, potatoes, bitter melon, 'pechay', green pepper, cabbage, garlic and onions to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted by KIVA lenders through ASKI so that she can make more improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as eggplants, potatoes, bitter melon and many more,

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is 37 years old, a married man with four children. He is uneducated, living in a poor area in Haja, Yemen. He has accumulated some money to renovate his house. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but now he is short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 115,999 YER to buy construction materials to use for his house. He hopes that after the completion of house renovation, he can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of his family and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use for his house.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona. She previously accessed a 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her children’s education costs and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ramona dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to give a good future to her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 54-year-old mixed farmer. She has been successfully practicing mixed farming for the past ten years and has a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. Lucy is applying for her first loan term from KADET Ltd. after she was introduced by an existing KADET client.  

She will use the loan to prepare her land for this planting season. With the anticipated profit from her farm, she will expand on her dairy farming project.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family and do well in her businesses.

loans.use: to prepare her land for the planting season

loans.name: 10 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 DE JUNIO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de insecticidas, venta de coca, elaboración de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de insecticidas (trampas para ratones y insecticidas): da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su amiga y hace varios años que trabaja en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de insecticidas) que adquirirá de las ferias por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “10 De Junio” Communal Bank is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Regional Hub. It is made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors. Juana is the treasurer. The members' business are varied and include: vegetable sales, weaving blankets, clothing sales, insecticide sales, coca sales, and shoemaking.
This loan will help these small businesses. Juana tells us that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago at the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution. Juana has an insecticide sales business (insecticides and rat traps). She tells us that she started this business at the recommendation of a friend, and she has worked in this area for several years.
This loan is for an increase in working capital (the purchase of insecticides) which she will acquire in the wholesale markets. She will later sell these products in her sales space. This work allows her to generate an income to maintain her household where possible. She is in a long-term relationship and has five children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. El tiene 38 años de edad, está acompañado; este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres, trabaja propio desde hace 11 años y lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12.00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar tres sacos de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, entre otros; este le permitirá tener el dinero necesario para invertir y aumentar las ganancias.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melvin works in farming basic foods to cover his home expenses.  He is 38 years old and has a spouse.  He learned this work from his parents, and has worked on his own for 11 years.  He works from Monday to Saturday from 6 am to 12 pm.

The loan he needs will allow him to buy three bags of fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seeds among other things.  This will allow him to have the necessary money to invest and increase his earnings.  His dream is to improve economically to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds among other things.

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABOU  est responsable du groupe SOLIDARITE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend divers marchandises (friperie, sel, savon liquide) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier pour les friperies et chez les grossistes pour le sel. Ses clients sont  les femmes et  les voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 04kg de pâte qui est utiliser pour la fabrication du savon, 02sacs de sel et 10drats de lit et 20petits  serviettes friperie.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte pour épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne devenir un grossiste et acquérir une moto.
texts.en:
Zenabou is the representative of the SOLIDARITE group.  She is married and the mother of two children.  Her oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest is 8.  Both her children go to school.

Zenabou has been selling various goods (used clothing, salt, liquid soap) for four years.  She buys used clothing at a market located in her neighborhood and salt from wholesalers.  Her customers are women and neighbors.

She wants to buy 4 kg. of paste used to make soap, two bags of salt, ten bed sheets and 20 small used towels.  She wants to open an account to save her profits.  She dreams of becoming a wholesaler and of purchasing a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 4 kg of paste used to make soap, 2 bags of salt, 10 bed sheets and 20 small used towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Nell

texts.en:
Nell is married and she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a food stall business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and theft as  her major challenges in the business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. Her dream is to expand her business to a restaurant and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Pengdewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATA  est responsable du groupe PENGDEWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 07personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation alimentaire (gâteaux) depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les enfants, les hommes, les femmes, les voisins etc.
Elle veut s’acheter 01bidon d’huile de 20l et 01sac de farine.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et si possible acquerir une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Aisatta is the leader of the "Pengdewende" group. She is married and has five children. The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 11. Three of the children attend school, and Ms. Aisetta has seven people in her care.
Ms. Aisetta has been involved in food preparation (cake making) for twelve years. She gets her supplies at the local market. Her customers are children, men, women, neighbours, etc.
She would like to buy one 20-L can of oil and one sack of flour.,
Ms. Aisetta wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and, if possible, acquire a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: To buy one 20-L can of oil and one sack of flour.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is a 33-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is married with a two-year-old son. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business in order to support their small family. This has been their business for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fishing net, nylon and paint for their boat. She believes that with hard work and enough finances, they can continue to sustain their business and be prosperous.


Zeny is an optimistic person and in the future, she hopes to have a bigger fishing business and a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and paint

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, such as fabric and thread, needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Magdalena dreams that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de su esposa.José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura razón por la cual se dirige 4 dias a la semana a ver sus terrenos de cultivo. Como una actividad complementaria, José también es albañil, realiza trabajos de construcción buscando incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida toda su familia. Hace dos años que viene desempeñándose como tal. Pero en sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades con sus cultivos por el clima, ya que no producían y se echaba a perder, pero no se dio por vencido y siempre siguió adelante. Es así que despues de muchos años de experiencia decidió dedicar a la producción del cacao, y ahora con los ingresos extras que obtiene siendo albañil pudo comprarse un terreno exclusivamente para esta producción.Para José este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
José is 45 and lives in his parents' home with his parents and his wife. He has always worked in agriculture, and goes out to his lands four days a week. On the side, he is also a bricklayer. He does construction projects in order to increase his income and improve the quality of life of his entire family. He has been doing this for twelve years.
In the beginning he had a lot of difficulty with his crops because of the climate; they were not producing and he lost a lot of them. However, he did not give up and always kept moving forward. After many years of experience, he decided to produce cocoa. Now, with his extra income from his work as a bricklayer, he has been able to buy a plot of land for exclusive cocoa production. This is José's first loan on Kiva. He is grateful for this economic support and promises to be punctual with his payments. With the requested 1500 soles, he will purchase organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel, es casado su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y van a la escuela todos, el trabaja como operario en una institución estatal, solicita este crédito para terminar la construcción de un anexo que logró hacer con el crédito anterior e invertirá en instalación de techo, embaldosado y repello, para brindarle a su familia un lugar seguro y digno.
texts.en: Manuel is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  He has three children that depend on him and they all go to school.  He works as an operator in a state institution.  He is requesting this loan to finish the construction of an annex that he was able to build with a previous loan, and invest in installing a roof, reinforced and whitewashed, to offer his family a secure respectable place.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn, 32, is a married woman with four children (three children who are in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Arlyn requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, bread, etc., in her general store. Arlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, bread, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
This is Jenneth, 37, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, a construction worker, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jenneth operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers create every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding down the highway in a speeding jeepney. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Jenneth hopes to expand her business so she can help her workers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man, aged 46, with five children aged between 5 and 10 years old. He is a mixed farmer in Koibatek, both farming and rearing livestock. His business has been in operation for a period of 15 years, and he earns an income of 50,000 KES.

He has borrowed 70,000 KES from KADET Ltd., his fifth loan, and wishes to purchase a motorbike that will help him in transporting his farm produce. The profits he earns will be saved to enable him to purchase a vehicle.

He wishes to own and develop his own plot.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting the produce from his farm

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 38 años, es una mujer soltera y madre de 3 hijas.Tiene una casa de madera donde vive con su pequeña familia.Se dedica a la venta productos comestibles tales como arroz , leche , fideos , verudras , entre otros en su puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad.Anteriormente trabajaba en el campo cosechando cacao orgánico pero al sentirse alejada de sus hijas decidió ocupar un  puesto que le fue cedido por su prima.
Empezó con pocos productos al no tener suficiente capital de trabajo pero con el tiempo y esfuerzo logro ampliarlo hasta convertirlo en el principal sustento económico de su familia.Día a día recibe a sus clientes quienes son principalmente amas de casa , su buen trato y humor le han permitido obtener buenas ventas y a su vez muy buenos ingresos económicos.Cuenta constantemente con la ayuda de sus dos menores hijas quienes la apoyan cuando el negocio esta lleno de clientes.Su principal objetivo es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas añadiendo productos que aun no vende como carne de res y pollo fresco.En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 soles para comprar pescado fresco que solicita a otra localidad , así como tambien frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Faustina is 38. She is a single mother of three daughters. She lives in a wooden house with her small family. She sells edible products such as rice, milk, pasta, and vegetables from her stall located in the local market. Previously, she worked in the fields harvesting organic cocoa. However, she felt that she was not able to spend enough time with her daughters, so she decided to take over a stall that her cousin gave her.
She started off with just a few products because she did not have enough working capital. With time and hard work she was able to expand her business until it became her family's main economic support. Every day, she receives her customers. They are mainly housewives. Her good treatment and humour have allowed her to make good sales and a very good income. Her two youngest daughters always help her when the business is busy.
Faustina's main goal is to expand her business in order to increase her sales and add products that she does not yet sell such as fresh beef and chicken. Now, she would like to have 3,000 soles for the purchase of fresh fish, which is requested at another store, and to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Dúo Juntas Venceremos Group

texts.es:
DUO JUNTAS VENCEREMOS
Doña María Magdalena es originaria de la aldea chajalajya del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 44 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 8 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y a la agricultura.
Desde hace años ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el y de toda su familia ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para tener mejores ganancias y poder mandar sus hijos a la escuela,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Juntas Venceremos
Doña María Magdalena is from the small village of Chajalajya, in Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 44 and has 8 young children to care for. She makes handcrafts and works in agriculture.
She has done this for eight years, as this is the way she can get ahead.
Her husband works as a day labourer, and thanks to his support and the support of their entire family, her business is moving forward.
Her dream is to expand her business more in order to have a better income and to be able to send her children to school. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic supplies for making traditional weavings for sale.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making traditional weavings for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 29 years old, married to Catherine, and blessed with a two year old child. He is a mechanic, a business he ventured into 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has requested a fourth loan of 60,000 KES to pay for his college fees. He dreams of buying his own home.

loans.use: To pay for his college fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, accessories and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Badamkhand

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamkhand, 52 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own old house on a plot of land. She has been working as an office manager at a private transportation bureau for thirty-eight consecutive years and she is well known for her skills and abilities. 

Using her previous loan, she purchased an automobile for her son to use for a taxi service. Now her son is rendering taxi service day and night, contributing to the family income. Her husband has retired from work and now stays at home. The house they live in loses its heat greatly during winter time and the family uses lots of coal for heating. So she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 Tugriks (MNT) to purchase a low pressure furnace. Using this item, her family will reduce their coal consumption thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a low pressure furnace

loans.name: Sylvana

texts.en:
Sylvana is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of one child. She has been working as a hair dresser for ten years. She works from her house to make sure that she is taking care of her family and business at the same time. She is well known in the region, with her good reputation and talent.

Most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

Sylvana is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special chair and wigs necessary for her business, because she is planning to have brides as clients.

Sylvana hopes to develop her business in a way that she can open her own beauty salon outside her house to keep her customers pleased and her family relaxed.

loans.use: To buy a special chair and wigs necessary for her business

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Jagna, Bohol. This is the source of her income.

Benedicta is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages. Through this additional inventory, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, which will allow her to augment her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages

loans.name: Katia Marcela

texts.es:
Katia, se dedica a la venta de joyas de fantasía,  enchape y lociones. El tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su mama, la cual tiene 53 años de edad y asimismo tiene cinco hermanos; este oficio lo realiza desde hace tres años, lo lleva a cabo en ratos libres de su trabajo y los fines de semana.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cadenas, aretes, anillos, pulseras, entre otros productos; le ayudara a aumentar el inventario y obtener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Katia sells costume jewelry, plated items, and lotions.  She is 28 years old and lives with her 53 year old mother and five siblings.  She has had this business for three years and has been doing this in her free time and on the weekends.

She needs this loan to buy chains, earrings, rings, bracelets, and other things.  This will help her increase her inventory and earnings.

Her dream is to strengthen her business and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia,solicita un nuevo prestamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo, ya que estos son una fuente financiera que ayudan a obtener ganancias; Este le permitira comprar tela para uniformes, zippers, botones, hilo, blonda, entre otros; este le ayudara adquirir la tela para que los estudiantes no tengan que ir a comprar a otro lugar, asimismo tener todo lo necesario para elaborar el trabajo.
El credito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las ventas y utilidades, ya que se dedicaba a la venta de comida; las condiciones economicas y las circusntancias familiares se han optimizado, es por ello que opta por un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia is requesting a new loan because she needs to continue investing, since it is a financial source that helps her obtain earnings.  This allows her to buy fabric for uniforms, zippers, buttons, thread and doilies among other things.  This will help her get fabric so that students don't have to go buy it at another location, in this way she'll have everything necessary to do the work.

The previous loan helped her improve sales and utilities, since she worked in selling food.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved, and due to this she has decided to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for uniforms, zippers, buttons, thread and doilies among other things

loans.name: Juana Raquel

texts.es:
La cliente Juana, vive en la perimetral, ella comenzó con su negocio cuando ingreso a una capacitación en una fundación a donde aprendió manualidades entre una de estas hacer muñecas de trapo. En la actualidad tiene su negocio de venta de muñecas de trapo. 

Para realizar las muñecas de trapo necesita materia prima como telas, hilos etc. Poco a poco a incrementado su negocio. La única dificultad es que en ciertas ocasiones se enferma. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas e hilos para poder hacer mas muñecas y venderlas. En el futuro quiere tener una micro empresa establecida.
texts.en: Juana lives along the beltway and started her business when she took a course at a foundation where she learned to make manual arts among which was making rag dolls.  She currently has a business selling rag dolls.  To make the rag dolls she needs raw materials like fabric, thread, etc.  She’s gradually increased her business.  The only difficulty she faces is when she gets sick occasionally.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread to be able to make more dolls and to sell them.  In future, she’d like to have an established micro business firm.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a livestock trading business in the Philippines.

Cristy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Cristy has been in this business for two years now.

Cristy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 47 years old and has two children. Delia is married and has one child who is in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda earns a living through her milled rice retailing business. Chanda is a married woman from Jagna, Bohol and a mother of four children. She has been in business for more than 2 years now. 

Chanda is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her business and more importantly her income. In addition, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Dúo Cipresales Group

texts.es:
DUO CIPRESALES
Doña Graciela es originaria de la aldea Chajalajya, Tecpan Guatemala tiene 61 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 2 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos.
Desde hace años ella empezó con esta actividad ya que es el medio que ella tiene para salir adelante.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con sus actividades ya  que ella es la responsable del hogar.
Ella sueña con tener un negocio mas amplio para tener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas para la agricultura.
texts.en:
CIPRESALES DUO

Graciela is from the village of Chajalajya in Tecpan, Guatemala.  She’s 61-years-old and has two minor children in her care.  She works in agriculture and raises chickens.  She started this activity years ago and it’s her means of support.  Thanks to support from her children she continues forward with her activities since she’s the head of household.  She dreams with having a larger business in order to earn higher profits and to send her children to school.  She’s requesting this loan to buy seeds for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Belgica Yanett

texts.es:
La cliente Belgica vive en Quevedo. Comenzó su negocio de crianza de cerdos y pollos para tener ingresos y asi poder ayuda a su hijo en los gastos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio pero a pesar de que ya tenia una actividad económica ella decidió comenzar vendiendo productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumes etc. 

Poco a poco comenzó a ser una mujer emprendedora, hasta ahora que tiene sus dos negocios ya establecidos con clientes y les vende pollos, también perfumes, cosméticos y cremas.    

El préstamo lo quiere invertir en la comprar de pollos y útiles escolares para su hijo de 15 años de edad quien ya ingreso al colegio. En el futuro quiere incrementar en su negocio y así tener mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Belgica lives in Quevedo.  She started her business raising chickens and pigs in order to earn income to be able to help with her son’s expenses.  She gradually increased business but even though she already had an economic activity she decided to start selling beauty products like cosmetics, perfume, etc.

She gradually began to become an entrepreneur and to date has two well-established businesses with customers to whom she sells chickens but also perfume, cosmetics and creams.

She wants to use the loan to buy chickens and school supplies for her 15-year-old son who has enrolled in high-school.  In future, she’d like to increase business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy chickens and school supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married, and her husband is a businessman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and theft in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zam's Group

texts.en:
Zam's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Zam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Zam has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans. 

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge and more maize, rice, sugar and soap to sell.  This will help Zam to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Zam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her poultry farm and be a big supplier in the whole town. 

Zam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more a fridge and maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина замужняя женщина. Ей 34 года. Она мать несовершеннолетних детей. Нигина со своей семьей живет в городе Кургантюбе. Она предприимчивая и предусмотрительная  женщина. Нигина имеет среднее образование. Она занималась продажей женских одежд  в течение 10 лет. Но, к сожалению рынок, где она работала сгорел. Теперь Нигина хочет восстановить и продолжить бизнес. Для осуществления цели ей необходима денежная сумма. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения товара, и начать бизнес заново. В деятельности ей будут помогать друзья. Нигина любит свое дело и ей нравится получать доход от бизнеса. В будущем она планирует расширить деятельность и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Nigina is a married woman. She is 34 years old. She has underage children. Nigina lives with her family in the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is an enterprising and prudent person. Nigina has secondary education. She has been selling women’s clothing for 10 years. But, unfortunately, the market where she used to work burned down. Now Nigina would like to restore and continue her business. To make this happen, she needs funds. She is requesting a loan to buy stock and to relaunch her business. Her friends will help her out. Nigina enjoys her work and likes being able to earn money from her business. In the future, she plans to expand her activity and increase the standards of living.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
This is Roy. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the needed materials in his barber shop. He was able to generate more income which helped a lot in their household expenditures and his children's education. He and his wife are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan to buy clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials needed in his barber shop. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Roy hopes to have another branch and dreams to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clippers, trimmer accessories, shampoo, towels, neck strips and other materials needed in his barber shop.

loans.name: Dionelyn

texts.en:
Dionelyn works hard to support her family. Dionelyn is single and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Dionelyn requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Dionelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Dionelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather for making shoe uppers

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Juston is in his early 30s, married, and has one daughter who attends school.  He has been using his loans to operate his photography business since 2000. He works from 6.00 AM to midnight if he is photographing a wedding or other ceremony.  He earns a small monthly profit.

Juston is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy small items such as long cables and a better camera stand and to replace any item which are spoiled.  He used the previous loans to buy a new and up-to-date camera. He used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.   

Juston will share this loan with his loan group "Mawela," which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase long cables and a better camera stand.

loans.name: Umer

texts.en: Umer is a 29-year-old enterprising man who has been running a shoe shop for 5 years. He has been selling quality shoes at a very reasonable rate due to which his sales are increasing day by day. He has 3 children and a wife. Umer has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Umer would be able to expand his business. He would purchase new varieties of quality shoes to offer to his customers. This would increase his sales and net income. As they are living in a rented house Umer would purchase his own house with the profits. Umer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new variety of shoes

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad,  habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla,  ubicado a la orilla del mar caribe. Ella se dedica a generar ingresos,  mediante la  venta de mercancía variada que exhibe en el catalogo, ofrecido por la empresa a la cual está adscrita. Su oferta la conforman artículos de perfumería, cosméticos y de aseo personal, la cual vende a su clientela, mediante créditos a corto plazo y también de contado. Los principales clientes de Rosa, son sus vecinos del barrio y de otros sectores aledaños, que le han referido sus más leales compradores. Su meta es organizar un local, para establecer su punto de ventas y ofrecer de todo un poco, de lo que su clientela requiere, para generar  mayores ingresos y más adelante  ahorrar poder remodelar su casa,  como es su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara colonias, perfumería productos de higiene personal entre otros, que son los artículos que le ofrecen un margen de utilidad permanente pues rotan fácilmente.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 and lives in a municipality close to the city of Barranquilla, located on the shores of the Caribbean ocean. She makes an income from selling products from a catalogue from a company to whom she subscribes. Her inventory includes perfume items, cosmetics, and personal care products. She sells these items to her clients on short-term credit and also for cash. Her main customers are her neighbours and residents of the surrounding areas, who have referred her most loyal buyers to her. Her goal is to have a store in order to establish a sales point, and to offer a bit of everything that her customers require in order to generate more income. She would like to save up to remodel her home, which is her dream. She is applying for a loan on Kiva, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy cologne, perfume, and personal care products. These items offer a good utility margin because they sell frequently.

loans.use: to buy cologne, perfume, and other products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and aged parents). She has a pub and has been in this business for ten years. 
She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and spirits. She works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked pub and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and spirits
